MainPackage

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • MainPackage.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    The Database class allows for a simple interface between the program and the database. It allows communication between the program and the database in a uniform way.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Martin Juul Petersen (mjup@itu.dk), Jesper Nysteen (jnys@itu.dk) and Jonas Kastberg (jkas@itu.dk)

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Database getInstance()
        Gets a reference to the current instance of the Database.
        Returns:
        a Database instance

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String sQuery)
        Executes the given query on the MySQL database that has been connected to. The function expects the input to be a valid query, otherwise an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        sQuery - - the query to actually execute as a string
        Returns:
        a ResultSet containing the results of the query that was executed

      • AddValue

        public boolean AddValue(java.lang.String sTable,
               java.lang.String... args)
        Adds a row of data to the given table using the values in the Vararg array.
        Parameters:
        sTable - - a string containing the name of the table to perform the operation on.
        args - - a Vararg array containing all the values to add. The length must correspond to the amount of columns in the specified table.
        Returns:
        a Boolean indicating whether or not the operation succeeded.

      • UpdateValue

        public boolean UpdateValue(java.lang.String sTable,
                  int ID,
                  java.lang.String... args)
        Updates the values in the columns to the provided values.
        Parameters:
        sTable - - a String containing the name of the table to perform the operation on.
        ID - - an integer specifying exactly which row in the table to perform this operation on.
        args - - a Vararg array containing the names of the columns and also which value to add. This functions assumes that the Vararg array uses the following format: "ColumnName, ValueToSet, ColumnName, ValueToSet, ColumnName ..."
        Returns:
        a Boolean indicating whether or not the operation succeeded.

      • DeleteValue

        public boolean DeleteValue(java.lang.String sTable,
                  java.lang.String... args)
        Deletes all values in the specified table where the values in Vararg array matches.
        Parameters:
        sTable - - a String containing the name of the table to perform the operation on.
        args - - a Vararg array containing the names of the columns and also what value this field should equal to. This functions assumes that the Vararg array uses the following format: "ColumnName, ValueToEqual, ColumnName, ValueToEqual, ColumnName ..."
        Returns:
        a Boolean indicating whether or not the operation succeeded.

      • Add

        public int Add(Uploadable uploadable)
        Uploads the given object to the database. The Object is serialized using Java's builtin serializing system and is placed into it's respective table on the database.
        Parameters:
        uploadable - - the object implementing the Uploadable interface to upload to the database
        Returns:
        the generated id(s) of the operation

      • Replace

        public boolean Replace(int iID,
              java.lang.Object object)
        Replaces the serialized object in the data with the provided object.
        Parameters:
        iID - - the ID of the object to be replaced.
        object - - the object that will be put into the database instead.
        Returns:
        a Boolean indicating whether or not the operation succeeded.

      • Get

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.Object Get(int iID)
        Deprecated. 

      • Get

        public <T> T Get(int iID,
        java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Returns the object from the database with the given ID of the given type.
        Parameters:
        iID - - the ID of the object to return.
        type - - the class of the object that is to be returned.
        Returns:
        the object found with the ID casted to the proper type.

      • Get

        public <T> java.util.ArrayList<T> Get(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Returns all objects from the database with the given class type.
        Parameters:
        type - - the class of the object to be returned.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList filled with all objects that exists in the database with the given type.

      • GetID

        public int GetID(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Calculates the ID of the next object in table of the database.
        Parameters:
        type - - the class of the object to be returned.
        Returns:
        the ID of the next object in the table of the database.
